sub_title: Musicologist, singer. Postdoc researcher in Cultural Diplomacy.
summary:
I am a multilingual singer, teacher and researcher with background academic education acquired in Paraguay (country of birth), Brazil and Argentina. 

As an artist, I performed and toured extensively from 2006 to 2018. I specialised in Latin American music, singing and communicating in Spanish, Portuguese, English or Guarani with global audiences. I have two award-winning albums recorded in collaboration with Purahéi Trio, which are in turn connected to my research, as per below. This multicultural ensemble unites musicians from the countries above.

As a researcher, I published academic works focused on diverse topics such as music at border regions between Paraguay, Brazil and Argentina; the role of Paraguayan women in Paraguay's history, music and transmission of the indigenous language Guarani; Brazilian music vocal performance and singing curricula in music higher education in Latin America, and more, as I detail below about my current research work. 

Furthermore, as a teacher, I have designed and taught courses for organisations and music festivals, focusing on music from the Southern Cone in Latin America. I.e. Chile, Bolivia, Argentina, Paraguay, Uruguay and Brazil. My courses introduce the listener to the cultural diversities in these countries, transiting across various landscapes and areas of study. I depart from music analysis and explore the lyrics' content from a geographic, historical and sociolinguistic perspective. In this way, Latin American songs serve as a means to grasp the complexity and beauty of peoples and cultures beyond realms of national limits. 

Relocated in the UK in 2018, I am a doctoral researcher at the Music Department, Royal Holloway University of London. My current work focuses on the use of the indigenous language Guarani in Paraguayan popular songs. Paraguay is one of those rare cases where the language of the coloniser and the colonised are still spoken by a large part of its population. In my thesis, I explore how Guarani, alongside Spanish, is expressed and negotiated in different private and public spheres of communication (e.g. corporate media, political communications, education). From this macro-perspective, I then focus specifically on the use of Guarani in music education, vocal performance and composition of Paraguayan popular songs.

Living in the Netherlands since end of 2021, I aim to learn the Dutch language. 

I am to become the first Paraguayan woman to obtain a PhD degree in the field of ethnomusicology.

treasury_media.title: Ciclo de Conferencias Jeporeka 2021 - Buscando una voz paraguaya
treasury_media.description: “Buscando una voz paraguaya: el idioma guaraní en la interpretación, transmisión y composición de la canción popular paraguaya” Disertantes: Romy Martínez y Dr. Alfredo Colmán.

treasury_media.title: Tan lejos y tan cerca del alma guaraní - ABC Revista - ABC Color
treasury_media.description: Mediante una beca “Carlos Antonio López”, en junio de 2018, el doctorado en etnomusicología llevó a Romy Martínez a la Royal Holloway University de Londres, Inglaterra. Un lugar tan distinto y tan lejano en el que cada día se siente más integrada a su identidad paraguaya.

treasury_media.title: Jeporeka invita a ciclo sobre identidad de la música paraguaya
treasury_media.description: El programa Jeporeka, impulsado por la guitarrista Berta Rojas, invita a un ciclo gratuito de conferencias virtuales que se inicia este miércoles sobre la identidad de la música paraguaya.

treasury_media.title: Darán charla sobre mujeres paraguayas en la música - Artes y Espectáculos - ABC Color
treasury_media.description: La cantante y etnomusicóloga paraguaya Romy Martínez, que se encuentra cursando un doctorado en la Universidad de Londres, Inglaterra, presentará hoy un trabajo acerca de las mujeres paraguayas en la música.

treasury_media.title: Música paraguaya “Cruzando fronteras”, en Londres - Música - ABC Color
treasury_media.description: Romy Martínez, cantante y etnomusicóloga oriunda de Ciudad del Este y becaria por BECAL en el Reino Unido, presenta el concierto “Crossing border series” junto al duo de guitarristas Che Valle y el duo Purahei Soul. La actividad apoyada por la Embajada de Paraguay en Londres.

treasury_media.title: Purahei Trio
treasury_media.description: Music and musicians from border regions.

treasury_media.title: Purahéi Trío lanza nuevo material discográfico - 3 Fronteras - ABC Color
treasury_media.description: CIUDAD DEL ESTE (Mariana Ladaga, de nuestra redacción regional). Purahéi Trío, grupo integrado por la artista esteña Romy Martínez, lanzó el pasado viernes su último material discográfico, “Yrupa purahéi”, trabajo que rinde homenaje musical a tres fronteras.

profile_positions.company: Leiden University - Faculty of Governance and Global Affairs
profile_positions.title: Postdoc Researcher - Cultural Diplomacy and Musicology

profile_positions.description: Via digital platforms, I work in collaboration with the EDI group, implementing the anti-racist action’ plan distributed to the BFE membership. The goal is to craft safe spaces for effective debates and initiatives, fostering a more equitable, diverse and inclusive environment for ethnomusicology and music higher education in the United Kingdom.
profile_positions.title: Member of Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Working Group

profile_positions.description: I worked as a remote researcher of a retained executive search team. Riverhouse partners supports capital owners in developed and growth regions across public and private markets.
profile_positions.title: Executive Researcher

profile_positions.description:
My thesis explores the indigenous language Guarani, which is second official in Paraguay, alongside Spanish. It brings together methods and concepts from sociolinguistics, history, music and ethnomusicology. The transdisciplinary and multilingual approach of this work focuses on three main aspects: vocal performance, looking into singing styles; transmission in music education, observing both formal and informal learning processes; and, finally, composition; where the last aspect comprises connections between language and the construction of melodies and lyrics. 
I observe both the colonial and the indigenous voices, raising questions about language marginalisation and value from a decolonial perspective.
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate

profile_positions.description: I provided advice on developmental aspects of postgraduate study such as, working with colleagues and supervisors, work/life balance and networking in the academic environment.
profile_positions.title: Postgraduate Peer mentor

profile_positions.description: I taught and assisted undergraduate students undertaking the course of Introduction to world musics. The course approached cultures and musical aspects from three different continents: Americas, Africa, and Southeast Asia. It enabled students to compare and contrast across the various case studies, emphasising four key themes: (1) Mobility and Migration, (2) Mediation, (3) Environment, and (4) Sonorities. The role as a Postgraduate TA, also included e-module adaptation (due to COVID-19) and essay marking.
profile_positions.title: Introduction to World Musics - Teaching asssistant

profile_positions.description: Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Paraguay and Southern Brazil. However, what do these lands have in common culturally speaking, and how do popular songs tell us about through lyrics and music? The extension of these regions and their geographies has been culturally, historically and musically influenced by the natives peoples who inhabited them since before the colonial period and the foundation of the viceroyalty of Peru, in 1542, and the Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata, in 1776. In a series of seminars I bring together my roles as a performer and ethnomusicologist. I teach and sing to illustrate some of the music genres and forms in the border regions in Latin America. Based on a transdisciplinary and transnational approach intertwining history, linguistics and geography, I discuss Latin American popular musics observed in approximate maps and describe the cultural contexts of each song. Aditionally, by singing examples in class, I explain the peculiarities of the indigenous language Guarani, alongside Spanish and Portuguese. In this way, I explore the multilingual and multicultural background of the continent. Consequently, I guide the listener to perceive landscapes and regions, beyond geopolitical limits, views as cultural spaces where identities are constantly being negotiated and reshaped. The presentations introduce a broader comprehension of the concept of symbolic-cultural region, which transcends national borders as a consequence of the dynamics of arts and history in Latin America.
profile_positions.title: Beyond borders: Music, poetry and dance in the Latin American Southern Cone - Seminar Lead
Vocal Coach and English language phonology teacher

profile_positions.description: I designed and taught a summer course on music at the border regions of Paraguay, Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina. The course was aimed to demystify geopolitical boundaries, fostering critical thinking on cultural integration. The interdisciplinary approach was built on analysis of historical geographical, simbolyc and linguistic aspects featuring in the lyrics and music of popular songs from the above mentioned countries.
profile_positions.title: Songs by the riverbanks: Paraguay Argentina Brazil Uruguay - Workshop lead
